text.name: sys_description
text.text: RadioShack's CoCo Color Computer was based on Motorola's 6809 microprocessor and was part of the TRS-80 line. It had a 0.895 MHz processor and up to 64KB of RAM. The Coco II will be smaller, have a better keyboard and be able to display lower case letters. The Coco III will have a 68B09e processor capable of doubling the original frequency and 512 kB of RAM. As well as a new 'GIME' graphics chip allowing a maximum resolution of 640x225 and up to 16 colors from a palette of 64. (The 64 are available with a trick)
